intro: Senecio hypomalacus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsels, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Senecio hypomalacus is generally hardy and drought-tolerant, making it suitable for xeriscaping in suitable climates.
